text: Burgos-Rosa de Lima railway station serves the Spanish city of Burgos, Castile and León. The station opened in 2008, named after Peruvian saint Rose of Lima and serving around 300,000 passengers a year. ==Services== Burgos-Rosa de Lima is served by Alvia trains to Madrid-Chamartín and Barcelona Sants; and regional trains from A Coruña to Hendaye, Gijón, Bilbao-Abando and Vitoria- Gasteiz. ==References== Category:Railway stations opened in 2008 Category:Railway stations in Castile and León Category:Buildings and structures in Burgos
title: Burgos-Rosa de Lima railway station
